input_text:
Job Title: SOCSOUTH Program Support Manager

Location: Homestead, FL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Project Management

Description:
TITLE: SOCSOUTH Program Support Manager

LOCATION: HQ, SOCSOUTH, Homestead Air Reserve Base, FL

Overview

Streamline Defense is seeking an exceptionally qualified candidate to serve as a Program Support Manager in support of Special Operations Command South (SOCSOUTH).

Responsibilities 

Responsible for the orchestration and management of host-nation entry visa applications, overseeing sensitive electronics, and SOF equipment accounts. Develop and manage visa application programs, ensuring timely processing and adherence to international documentation requirements. Administer sensitive accounts, including electronics and SOF equipment, maintaining inventory control and monthly audits. Oversee contractor personnel schedules to ensure availability during designated hours. Manage material inventory, equipment, and property for the SOCSOUTH Operations Directorate (J3). Maintain expertise in Department of Defense logistics policies and procedures to support property accountability and control. Utilize the Global Combat Support System – Army (GCSS-A) for accurate accounting of non-expendable property. Coordinate visa-related matters, including travel documentation and immigration requirements for military and civilian personnel. Serve as an authoritative source for visa application procedures and official documentation verification. Liaise with high-level Consulate representatives to facilitate official visa acquisitions for USSOUTHCOM AOR SOF missions. Support equipment requirements for partner nations, adhering to sections 2282/333 and 127e program guidelines. 
Requirements

Possess and maintain a current SECRET level security clearance. 10 years’ prior military experience. Minimum of 5 years of logistical experience with asset management/inventory control. 3 years’ experience working with GCSS-A or similar DoD inventory system. Knowledgeable on, and able to reference, official travel regulations and procedures. Familiar with the process of facilitating VISA applications (i.e., development of VISA application package/Embassy submittal/tracking status). Strong coordination skills with the ability to manage complex documentation processes. 

About Streamline

Streamline is a professional and technical solutions company focused on the U.S. Defense, Intelligence, and Special Operations communities. Our talented team of analyst, engineers, and military professionals support our clients most demanding missions. We offer an unmatched opportunity to grow and learn in an exciting and entrepreneurial environment. Highly motivated individuals will find a culture that values their individual input and compensates them well for their efforts.

Streamline provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
